verses.verse: Now the serpent<WH5175> was<WH1961> more subtle<WH6175> than any animal<WH2416> of the field<WH7704> which the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> had made<WH6213>. And he said<WH559> unto the woman<WH802>, Yes<WH637>, has God<WH430> really said<WH559>, You shall not eat<WH398> of every tree<WH6086> of the garden<WH1588>?
And the woman<WH802> said<WH559> to the serpent<WH5175>, We may eat<WH398> of the fruit<WH6529> of the trees<WH6086> of the garden<WH1588>:

But of the fruit<WH6529> of the tree<WH6086> which is in the middle<WH8432> of the garden<WH1588>, God<WH430> has said<WH559>, You shall not eat<WH398> of it<WH5060>, neither shall you touch it<WH6435>, lest you die<WH4191>.
And the serpent<WH5175> said<WH559> to the woman<WH802>, You shall not surely<WH4191> die<WH4191>:

For God<WH430> does know<WH3045> that in the day<WH3117> you eat<WH398> it<WH5869>, then your eyes shall be opened<WH6491>, and you will be as gods<WH430>, knowing<WH3045> good<WH2896> and evil<WH7451>.

And when the woman<WH802> saw<WH7200> that the tree<WH6086> was good<WH2896> for food<WH3978>, and that it<WH1931> was pleasant<WH8378> to the eyes<WH5869>, and a tree<WH6086> to be desired<WH2530> to make one wise<WH7919>, she took<WH3947> of the fruit of it<WH6529>, and did eat<WH398>, and gave<WH5414> also<WH1571> to her husband<WH376> with her<WH398>; and he did eat.

And the eyes<WH5869> of them both<WH8147> were opened<WH6491>, and they<WH1992> knew<WH3045> that they were naked<WH5903>; and they sewed<WH8609> fig<WH8384> leaves<WH5929> together<WH8609>, and made themselves<WH6213> aprons<WH2290>.

And they heard<WH8085> the voice<WH6963> of the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> walking<WH1980> in the garden<WH1588> in the cool<WH7307> of the day<WH3117>: and Adam<WH120> and his wife<WH802> hid themselves<WH2244> from the presence<WH6440> of the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> among<WH8432> the trees<WH6086> of the garden<WH1588>.
And the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> called<WH7121> unto Adam<WH120>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH335>, Where are you?
And he said<WH559>, I heard<WH8085> your voice<WH6963> in the garden<WH1588>, and I was afraid<WH3372>, because I<WH595> was naked<WH5903>; and I hid myself<WH2244>.
And he said<WH559>, Who<WH4310> told<WH5046> you that you were naked<WH5903>? Have you eaten<WH398> of the tree<WH6086> that I commanded you<WH6680> that you should not<WH1115> eat<WH398>?
And the man<WH120> said<WH559>, The woman<WH802> whom you gave<WH5414> to be with me<WH5978>, she<WH1931> gave<WH5414> me of the tree<WH6086>, and I did eat<WH398>.

And the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> said<WH559> unto the woman<WH802>, What is this that you have done<WH6213>? And the woman<WH802> said<WH559>, The serpent<WH5175> deceived me<WH5377>, and I did eat<WH398>.

And the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> said<WH559> unto the serpent<WH5175>, Because you<WH859> have done<WH6213> this<WH779>, you are cursed above all cattle<WH929>, and above every animal<WH2416> of the field<WH7704>; upon your belly<WH1512> shall you go<WH3212>, and dust<WH6083> shall you eat<WH398> all the days<WH3117> of your life<WH2416>:

And I will put<WH7896> enmity<WH342> between you and the woman<WH802>, and between your seed<WH2233> and her seed<WH2233>; He shall bruise<WH7779> your head<WH7218>, and you shall bruise<WH7779> his heel<WH6119>.

To the woman<WH802> he said<WH559>, I will greatly<WH7235> multiply<WH7235> your pain<WH6093> in your pregnancy<WH2032>; in sorrow<WH6089> you shall bring forth<WH3205> sons<WH1121>; and your desire<WH8669> shall be to your husband<WH376>, and he shall rule over you<WH4910>.

And to Adam<WH121> he said<WH559>, Because you have listened<WH8085> to the voice<WH6963> of your wife<WH802>, and have eaten<WH398> of the tree<WH6086>, of which<WH834> I commanded you<WH6680>, saying<WH559>, You shall not eat<WH398> of it<WH779>: cursed is the ground<WH127> for your sake<WH6093>; in sorrow shall you eat<WH398> of it all<WH3605> the days<WH3117> of your life<WH2416>;
Thorns also<WH6975> and thistles<WH1863> shall it bring forth<WH6779> to you<WH398>; and you shall eat the herb<WH6212> of the field<WH7704>;

By the sweat<WH2188> of your face<WH639> shall you eat<WH398> bread<WH3899>, until<WH5704> you return<WH7725> to the ground<WH127>; for out of it were you taken<WH3947>: for dust<WH6083> you<WH859> are<WH6083>, and to dust shall you return<WH7725>.
And Adam<WH120> called<WH7121> his wife<WH802>'s name<WH8034> Eve<WH2332>; because she was the mother<WH517> of all living<WH2416>.
To Adam<WH120> also and to his wife<WH802> did the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> make<WH6213> coats<WH3801> of skins<WH5785>, and clothed them<WH3847>.

And the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> said<WH559>, Behold<WH2005>, the man<WH120> is become as one<WH259> of us<WH3045>, to know good<WH2896> and evil<WH7451>: and now<WH7971>, lest he put forth his hand<WH3027>, and take<WH3947> also of the tree<WH6086> of life<WH2416>, and eat<WH398>, and live<WH2425> for ever<WH5769>:
Therefore the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> sent him forth<WH7971> from the garden<WH1588> of Eden<WH5731>, to until<WH5647> the ground<WH127> from which he was taken<WH3947>.

So he drove out<WH1644> the man<WH120>; and he placed<WH7931> at the east<WH6924> of the garden<WH1588> of Eden<WH5731> Cherubims<WH3742>, and a flaming<WH3858> sword<WH2719> which turned every way<WH2015>, to guard<WH8104> the way<WH1870> of the tree<WH6086> of life<WH2416>.
